column4: anyone knows where i can find an english ubuntu alternative installation guide wiht pics ?
what part is not clear to you ?
the alt-cd asks you basic questions in english
/etc/init.d is the boot scripts core directory
have you tested the script first
yes it works from teh shell
check you set the path in your script
it is correct i did copy what i wrote on rc.local to the terminal and it did work
thats not what I said, your shell environment may be different than the execution shell
what u mean ? i put the full script bath
your user shell path maynot be the same as the default path userd
i know it is not in the path but i put the full path of the script /var/www/goeserver/bin/startup.sh
I missed your last message, sorry
i added /var/www/geoserver/bin/startup.sh into rc.local and it is still not loading :-s
do you have any non-absoloute paths ?
you need a shell script to launch it, yes
? look i have /var/www/geoserver/bin/startup.sh i want it to be running when i start my machine .. and i added it into rc.local and it didn't work .. any idea why ? where to debug or how !?
